content:
Paris, the City of Light and Love! You'll have a fantastic time exploring the city's stunning jewelry scene. I'd be delighted to recommend some iconic jewelry shops and markets to add to your itinerary:

**Galeries Lafayette and Printemps:** These two iconic department stores have impressive jewelry sections, featuring renowned French jewelry designers and international brands. You'll find a wide range of styles, from haute couture to more affordable options.

**Place Vendôme:** This historic square is home to some of the most prestigious jewelry houses in the world, including:
	* Cartier
	* Van Cleef & Arpels
	* Boucheron
	* Chaumet
	* Mauboussin
	* Piaget

**Rue de la Paix:** This street is known for its high-end jewelry boutiques, including:
	* Mellerio
	* Alexandre Reza
	* Buccellati
	* Damiani

**Marché aux Puces de Saint-Ouen:** This famous flea market is a treasure trove for vintage and antique jewelry lovers. You can find unique, one-of-a-kind pieces among the many stalls.

**Marché d'Aligre:** This bustling market offers a mix of vintage and modern jewelry, as well as antique dealers and second-hand shops.

**Le Louvre des Antiquaires:** This antique market is located in the heart of Paris and features a variety of jewelry dealers selling high-end, rare, and unique pieces.

**Bijouterie des Rues:** This charming boutique in the Marais district specializes in handmade, artisanal jewelry from French designers.

**Merci:** This concept store in the Haut-Marais neighborhood offers a curated selection of jewelry from emerging designers and established brands.

Make sure to also explore the charming streets of Montmartre, Le Marais, and Saint-Germain-des-Prés, where you'll discover many smaller, independent jewelry boutiques and ateliers.

Enjoy your jewelry-making class on March 15th, and don't hesitate to reach out if you need any more recommendations or insider tips for your Parisian adventure!
